intro: Rosilla lutea, commonly known as the yellow roselia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. Rosilla lutea typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening due to its vibrant color and unique foliage.
